rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that spending one-on-one time with your teen can help them do better at school? Today we will share some ideas to help you make the most of your time together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that spending one-on-one time with your teen can help them do better at school? Today we will share some ideas to help you make the most of your time together.

media_title.eng: Can having fun help teens learn? Yes! Tap play to learn how

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!

rows.media_title: Can having fun help teens learn? Yes! Tap play to learn how
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Learning does not only happen in school - it happens through fun activities, teamwork, and everyday moments. 
When we involve our teens and share decisions, we help them feel capable, confident, and connected to us.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Learning does not only happen in school - it happens through fun activities, teamwork, and everyday moments. 
When we involve our teens and share decisions, we help them feel capable, confident, and connected to us.

media_title.eng: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her teen bond and learn

media_transcript.eng:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.

rows.media_title: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her teen bond and learn
rows.media_transcript:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Caregivers and teens who spend time together often have happier, healthier relationships. But it is not always easy ‚Äî sometimes we can both get angry, get annoyed and argue or fight.

Let‚Äôs take a look at an example:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Caregivers and teens who spend time together often have happier, healthier relationships. But it is not always easy ‚Äî sometimes we can both get angry, get annoyed and argue or fight.

Let‚Äôs take a look at an example:

text_2.eng: One afternoon, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name is looking after her younger sibling @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name.

character_1_text.eng: (ü§î_thinking_) It has been such a hard day at school‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt wait for @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name to come home so I can tell her about it.

rows.text_2: One afternoon, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name is looking after her younger sibling @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name.
rows.character_1_text: (ü§î_thinking_) It has been such a hard day at school‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt wait for @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name to come home so I can tell her about it.
@data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, why did you not cook dinner yet?! Why do I always have to do everything myself?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name, why did you not cook dinner yet?! Why do I always have to do everything myself?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name was upset that her mother did not see how she helped at home

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name for helping at home.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name was not able to talk to her mother about her hard day at school

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name for helping at home.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name blamed @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name for not cooking dinner yet

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name for helping at home.

quiz_2_question.eng: How will this affect the relationship between @data.characters.f1_mother.name and her daughter, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name will not want to help with house chores, as her mother did not appreciate it

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
These are all true. @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name won‚Äôt want to help or talk to her mother, because her mother doesn‚Äôt thank or listen to her. 

She may treat her siblings the same way, because that‚Äôs what she has learned.

I am glad we have this time together. I actually wanted to tell you about a problem I had at school today.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name, you can call me when you are ready.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_2_question.eng: What did @data.characters.f1_mother.name do differently this time?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She took a few minutes for herself to relax and get settled at home before talking with her daughter, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She asked @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name to help with cooking, so she could get dinner done AND have time to talk

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She praised @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name for doing specific household chores

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: She showed @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name that she is available to talk and listen

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_3_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and her mother feel afterwards?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, talking while doing chores helped them both!

When you do a chore with your teen, take time for yourself, and give them space to talk, you help them feel safe to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a good relationship and teach them things they won‚Äôt learn at school.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Let‚Äôs think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let‚Äôs think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.

text_2.eng:
**Here are some ideas you could try today:**

üí¨ Storytelling: Share a story from your childhood or culture‚Äîor let your teen share one with you. It‚Äôs a fun way to connect and learn.
üö∂üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚Äç‚û°Ô∏èWalking: Take a walk together. It‚Äôs healthy and gives you both time to talk and share feelings.
üë©üèæ‚Äçüç≥ Cooking or cleaning: Ask your teen to help with cooking or cleaning. It‚Äôs a good time to talk and teach them why these things matter.

rows.text_2:
**Here are some ideas you could try today:**

üí¨ Storytelling: Share a story from your childhood or culture‚Äîor let your teen share one with you. It‚Äôs a fun way to connect and learn.
üö∂üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚Äç‚û°Ô∏èWalking: Take a walk together. It‚Äôs healthy and gives you both time to talk and share feelings.
üë©üèæ‚Äçüç≥ Cooking or cleaning: Ask your teen to help with cooking or cleaning. It‚Äôs a good time to talk and teach them why these things matter.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some skills you can use to help your teen learn!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some skills you can use to help your teen learn!

section_1_text.eng: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.

section_2_text.eng: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them ‚Äúlearn how to learn‚Äù, because they feel safe with you.

section_3_text.eng: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.

rows.section_1_text: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
rows.section_2_text: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them ‚Äúlearn how to learn‚Äù, because they feel safe with you.
rows.section_3_text: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Helping your teen learn can feel stressful, but doing fun daily activities together supports their growth and learning.

This week‚Äôs home practice is to try a few activities with your teen!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Helping your teen learn can feel stressful, but doing fun daily activities together supports their growth and learning.

This week‚Äôs home practice is to try a few activities with your teen!

text_2.eng:
It‚Äôs not always easy to find things to do with your teen.

Try dancing to your teen‚Äôs music or having a simple check-in chat, like asking, ‚ÄúWhat made you happy today?‚Äù or ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you try one fun activity this week with your teen, like dancing together or having a daily check-in chat?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Making time for fun and connection is a powerful way to support your teen‚Äôs learning and development.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You're doing well! Even small moments of fun and conversation can help your teen feel valued and motivated. Keep it up!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. It is not always easy to find time, but even one fun moment together can make a big difference. Try again when you are ready.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills - and it strengthens your bond. Even small changes, like listening more and playing together, can make a big difference.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills - and it strengthens your bond. Even small changes, like listening more and playing together, can make a big difference.

media_title.eng: Spending quality time together helped @data.characters.media_daughter_11.name and her mother connect and learn. Listen to their story

media_transcript.eng:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using @global.app_name, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions.

We play games, we sing together and other stuff‚Ä¶ She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like ‚Äúwhat you did is not good‚Äù and such.

rows.media_title: Spending quality time together helped @data.characters.media_daughter_11.name and her mother connect and learn. Listen to their story
rows.media_transcript:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using @global.app_name, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions.

We play games, we sing together and other stuff‚Ä¶ She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like ‚Äúwhat you did is not good‚Äù and such.
